titles.title: American Museum of Natural History 125th Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act
To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint coins in commemoration of the 125th anniversary of the founding of the American Museum of Natural History.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking, Finance + Urban Affrs

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Consumer Credit and Insurance.

committee.name: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 11/22/1993--Introduced. American Museum of Natural History 125th Anniversary Commemorative Coin Act - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to: (1) issue one-dollar silver coins emblematic of a prehistoric dinosaur and a view of the east front of the American Museum of Natural History (located on Central Park West in New York City); and (2) pay surcharges received from coin sales to the Budgetary Fund for the Museum.
